Hotel Kings Court
9 Excellent
Based on 152 reviews

We had a lovely weekend at Kings Court..... The location is excellent for getting to and from the airport, as well as for daily sightseeing around Prague's beautiful city.

It's worth spending the extra money and getting an Executive room, it's gives you an excellent room, view, free access to the spa (includes great sauna, steam, pool and jacuzzi) and executive lounge. Breakfast was great..... And staff were friendly and helpful. You really couldn't ask for anything more. We loved our weekend in Prague and the hotel had a lot to do with it - would definitely stay again when we are next in Prague.

Show more
Claire , United Kingdom
Friday Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 166 reviews

Let me start out by saying the location of this hotel is incredible! Prague is a great walking city and everything is close but this hotel is literally 2-3 minutes walking distance to many of the major tourist sites.

Anything else (i.e. Charles Bridge, historical Jewish synagogues, etc.) is 10-15 mins. tops! Also, 24-hour McDonalds is just across the small street (15 second walk), a large grocery store is a few minutes away to buy snacks and drinks for room, Wenceslas Square just a couple of minutes away, full street of shops and restaurants in front of hotel, and the Estates Theatre (where I saw Mozart's The Magic Flute) is only a 1 minute walk away! Now on to the hotel itself. Staff very nice and helpful and always willing to help. The room was modern, clean and well maintained. The daily breakfast was plentiful and diverse but I would recommend to change it up every 1-2 days. For those of us staying for a few days we want to see other options. But the food was always fresh and service was great. The internet was 100% reliable and fast, never had a problem. The TV was small compared to US standards and only had 1 international channel (CNN), but then again, who wants to watch much TV while on holiday? :-) And lastly, the price of the hotel cannot be beat for the location and quality. Not sure if I caught a good deal online or because it was the tail end of the winter when I stayed, but for the price I was very pleased!

Show more
Jason , United States
Radisson Blu Alcron Hotel
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 215 reviews

I recommend this Hotel to anyone travelling to Prague. Its rooms are of a very high standard in decor & are neat clean & modern.

The staff are young, friendly & helpful & went out of their way. The food served at breakfast was a highlight to be looked forward to with a smorgasboard that one would expect in a good hotel & provides comfort when you often cant find what you want in local restaurants. We enjoyed our breakfast & didnt eat again until later in the day. This was a contrast to the rest of our hotel experiences in Europe where beakfast was only a croisant, roll & jam! The locatin is great & in easy walking distance to the old town where all tourist activity is located with walking tours starting from under the clock in the main square. Shopping is closeby. A Subway opposite if you want a cheap snack. I would stay here if I went to Prague again & have already recommended the Raddison to people. Also it was lovely & warm inside while it was snowing outside. I think the windows were double glazed as I didnt hear one sound from outside. Overall it was our best stay in Europe! I highly recommend!

Show more
Susan , Australia
The Emblem Hotel
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 56 reviews

Experience at this hotel is one of those few things that you will not forget for the rest of your life! At least it will do exactly that for me.

I was impressed and at AWE with the service, location, cleanliness, friendliness, I could really go on and on and on.. Do stay at this hotel! This will one day be the BEST HOTEL IN PRAGUE! Yes I said it! :-) Thanks again for the hospitality, and I surely look forward to stay at your hotel again in the near future.

Show more
Andrew , Indonesia
Grand Hotel Praha
8.4 Excellent
Based on 32 reviews

Akcent Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 98 reviews

Location is OK, a lot of public transport nearby. The hotel itself is rather old and smelly. Rooms have twin beds, which are supposed to convert themselves into a double (which never quite works).

It may get noisy at night as all rooms are facing a busy street. Breakfast is borderline OK, and definitely nothing special. On balance it felt overpriced. Can be an option for a person(s) on budget, provided the rate is below ~70 Eur.

Show more
Leonid , Russia
The Grand Mark Prague
8.8 Excellent
Based on 41 reviews

Look out if you are booking here. We are presently staying and, for nearly 1400 USD for two rooms for two nights, were put into attic rooms with a small window at ceiling height which you could not even see out of.

When we asked to be moved, we were told there was nothing else available. It was oppressive, dated, worn, just bad. And beyond hot, which the staff could not seem to accommodate or have the courtesy to address. Unbelievably bad experience all the way around. Parts of the staff were grossly inexperienced, communicated inaccurate information, and did not have the experience or the empowerment to know how to address the issues. At 7:00 pm on a Friday evening, we were told the management had gone home but someone would contact us in the morning...unreal. Never again.

Show more
Jon , United States
Royal Road Residence
8.3 Excellent
Based on 144 reviews

Having visited Prague three times, I can definitely say that the location of this hotel is excellent.

It is close to many restaurants, shops, the Charles Bridge, and the Old Town Square. We stayed in the shared room which was simple, comfortable, and clean. We arrived late after reception closed but the staff had arranged to leave our keys at a nearby hotel and was very organized in leaving us instructions. They were so kind as to give us a bottle of champagne to celebrate New Year's Eve too. We didn't try the breakfast but it was available for an extra charge. Overall, if you're looking for a clean place to stay for a few nights it was a decent place. The location is definitely the best thing about this place.

Show more
Angela , Canada
Rott Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 133 reviews

We stayed here for 3 nights over the christmas period. This is our first visit to Prague and after hearing the horror stories wanted to avoid taking cabs.

Location The hotel is location just in Old Town Square, walking there is literally round the corner and 1 mins walk. Charles bridge is also a short walk away. Super convenient! There is a convenience store nearby should you need to stock up on drinks and snacks. Room We stayed here with another couple. Our room was a lot smaller but we had a huge bathroom. The windows on the top floor provides no view it is an attic window. It was charming and cosy. Very very basic amentities are provided, you will need to bring your own toiletries, water boiler etc. Breakfast The breakfast provided by the hotel was quite good by small European hotel standards. The drinks are as expected watered down, but the spread is quite substantial. The hotel lift was really cranky, it is good to stay at the top floor. We notice that it doesn't stop along the way down despite ppl standing and waiting for lifts.

Show more
Lesley , Singapore
InterContinental Prague
8.7 Excellent
Based on 38 reviews

Hotel is nice. Great staff - friendly and professional - breakfast room staff are excellent insisting on making you your coffee rather than let you get up to get it; concierge guys good; reception guys good.

Great location - simply a 5 minute walk to the Old Town Square. Facilities good - iron/iron board in room; top class gym. Breakfast is a good layout and plenty of choice. Value for money I marked down as the hotel does one thing that I find a pet hate of mine - they water down the breakfast orange juice and I mean extensively. The colour looks more 'watery' than orange and it tastes like what you'd expect - water not orange juice. Why they do this (ok it saves money) is beyond me - I'm staying in a guesthouse now which only has 10 rooms and they don't do it. Surely the Intercontinental should be bigger than this petty penny-pinching. I also marked cleanliness down as the carpet in the room was not so good. It had the plastic wrapping of a water bottle and a contact lense on the floor when I arrived. They were still there when I left 3 days later - perhaps the maid's hoover had broken! Perhaps I should have picked them up myself.

Show more
Steve , United Kingdom
Alchymist Grand Hotel and Spa
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 34 reviews

Reserved a Deluxe room, abd got upgraded to Family Suite upon arrival. The staff goes beyond the call of duty to make sure the stay and visit in Prague is inviting as can be, by recommending concerts, making reservasions, and dealing with every request we've made.

The hotel is very very clean, elegant, posh, and calm. The location is very close to Charles bridge and the old city. The food was delecious. Overall, I would be happy to stay there again on my next visit.

Show more
Dan , Israel
Grandior Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 69 reviews

Room was spacious and bright. Breakfast choices were wide with different types of bread, cheese, cold cut, cereal, omelette, warm food, juice, tes, coffee.

Little fruit and yogurt. Staff were efficient and respectful but curt. Schnitzel and goulash in cafe were ok but not memorable. Soup prices and bar prices were reasonable for a hotel. Walk to old town is around 20 minutes for a slow walker. Trams stop in front of hotel so it's convenient for those who prefer to ride. If you're arriving by bus from vienna, this is well located. After exiting building of bus terminal , walk to the left along the parking area and use the only visible cross walk. After crossing, a little bit to the right is the entrance to designhotel. Enter and walk Straight until you see escalator that says grandior hotel. The money changet across the street gave a good rate. There's a nearby pharmacy and grocery. The front desk gave a reliable recommendation to try la republica beer restaurant around 5-10 min slow walk away which had nice ambience and tasty food. The room amenities were complete. I just find the half glass partition for the tub/shower inefficient in keeping the splash away from the floor. Also a towel bar under the sink would be helpful.

Show more
Chittina , Philippines
B & B Hotel Prague -City
8.4 Excellent
Based on 285 reviews

This was my first trip to Prague... I arrived at B&B PLAGUE at midnight, but the receptionist was very very helpful and kind.

Before I arrived here actually I was little concerned about if the staff is not kind to Japanese guy like me... But in fact everybody in this hotel are AWESOME. Room was perfect. Especially bed is like a sleeping in a heaven. Actually i want to buy it for my room. Location is pretty good just by walking only 10min to city center and the metro&tram station's also very near. Except breakfast was not so good, I can't find any complaints about this hotel. I will stay there again. Arigato. プラハにはじめて行ったのですが、深夜に着いたのに男のスタッフがめっちゃ優しかった。差別されるんじゃないかとか思ったけど全くそんなことはなかった。部屋もきれい。ベッドが異常に気持ちよかった。リッツカールトンレベルのベッドだった。朝食はちょっと及第点かな…それ以外に何の文句もない。あまりに居心地が良くて二週間も住んでしまいました。 ありがとう。

Show more
Yohei , Japan
Charles Bridge Palace Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 103 reviews

1, the WORST service and staff training! ONLY ONE staff at reception desk no matter 1 or 100 guests, no matter 10am or 5pm! FIRSTLY, they made a mistake of my booking, I booked 4 rooms, they only kept 2 rooms for me.

and it took them 40 minutes to solve the problem, and there were OTHER GUESTS waiting in line! And the only reception staff is NOT FRIENDLY at all. Well, if only one person working at the reception for so many guests and problems, Who can have smily face all the time? 2,Breakfast cafe waitresses are always bad faces, very little smile, so basically, you don't feel welcomed! All these were Obviously because of BAD management and BAD on-job training. 3, After mid-night, main entrance is closed, so you have to ring the bell, but THE BELL IS OUT OF WORK!!!!!!! I am terribly sorry for this hotel! such a great location, beautiful building, but all these human incapabilities caused the 4-star is OVER RATED. 4,the only staff in hotel always smiling and apologised was the bell captain. He is not just helpful but VERY friendly and listen to the guests! But I'm so sorry he's just a bell captain, nothing he can save this POOREST service I've ever had!

Show more
Po-Ching , Taiwan
Eurostars Thalia Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 103 reviews

Good point: Rooms is clean and breakfast were many choices. The location is convenient to many signseeing points.

Things we were not satisfied: 1. No air-condition for our 3 nights stays under 32 degree. They don't know when the machine can be fixed. Don't suggest to stay there in this summer. 2. Staff were really unfriendly and helpful. Not very patience to answer our enquiries and no detail guiding about the city. 3.The room was noisy because it face the tram road.we can't open the window to sleep even we don't have condition in our room. 4. The design of the curton was really not good because it can't completely cover the light. So we have to sleep with light from outside road. 5. The light inside the room is really not enough. It is dark on the desk . 6. They dont provide any box tissue in the room. They claim they are 5 start hotel, but it is not. I comment that it is a 3 to 4 start hotel. If you expect it is 5 start hotel standard, I believe you will feel very disappointed. I don't recommend this hotel.

Show more
Miu , Hong Kong
Three Crowns Hotel Prague
7.7 Very good
Based on 61 reviews

Arrived to find that parking was 20€ extra and you need to book it before you arrive. Hotel is split into two parts, what you see on the web is the nice part, if you are booking cheap you will be in the George and Mildred (dated) side.

Room had no wifi, so managed to get moved to bottom floor to pick up lobby wifi. Given a room key for a occupied room, had to make my Czech excuses as to why i had walked into this woman's room. Oops! No air con, so opened window to listen to Jimmy nail pissed up. Room ok but dated. Pillows felt like they had been stuffed with shoes.

Show more
Findlay , United Kingdom
Hotel Sovereign Prague
8.7 Excellent
Based on 165 reviews

Very very nice hotel, loved the location, although about a 12 minute walk to the nearest subway station, if that's important to you.

One of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed at, and everything worked. Breakfast was good, but a few things missing like cooked ham, juices were not chilled. I didn't see much security at the front door, really anyone can just walk in and walk right up to the rooms. they do lock the front door at night, so after hours, you ring the bell. Very spacious bathroom, friendly staff. It was quite warm when I was there, and the air conditioning might not be strong enough for some, but it was unusually warm weather, so I wouldn't worry too much. There is a 24 hour convenience store around the corner which is nice. Good choice and good value in Prague.

Show more
James , United States
Hotel King David Prague
8.4 Excellent
Based on 50 reviews

the hotel it self looks okay, neighborhood not so appealing. room need to be clean especially the carpet, curtain a lot of stain.

cabinet in the room very old and hard to open door very tight to the floor carpet. staffs very friendly and one more thing restaurant host must be aware who's staying in the hotel while they having a breakfast, we saw two couples were eating breakfast that for sure that wasn't a guest of your hotel. touching every meals from your food dish with their fingers, very unappealing and disgusting. they looks like homeless and I can sure you that they are staying at the hotel....

Show more
shintia , Indonesia
Hotel Salvator
8.5 Excellent
Based on 118 reviews

Hotel Salvator is in a charming but relatively old building with a central courtyard, to which all rooms have a view.

The rooms are reminiscient of life in one of these apartments back in the day, with the old decor, wallpapers, furniture, and creaking wooden floors. It was fortunate we could not hear our neighbors, as we felt it was impossible for us to walk around without creating all that noise! Either way - these are all nice and good for the rooms if you are into this sort of thing. I am clearly not a huge fan. What I did like, though, was that the price was very good for the location. The hotel is just around the corner from the Namesty Republiky subway stop, and his also a short walk from the old town square and the river. During our 5-day stay, we never once used the subways, and got around the whole city completely on foot. On top of this, the hotel staff were nice and sweet - one of us happened to have our birthday during our stay, and the hotel staff left us a birthday card and some treats in our room as a surprise, which we discovered when we arrived later in the day! These little things are signs of the things the hotel staff do right. There is a dining option on the ground floor - it appears to be a Spanish-style tapas restaurant, but breakfast is served for hotel guests through here as well. We did NOT get to try out this restaurant for lunch or dinner. But we DID get to do breakfast here, which was really underwhelming and terrible cooking for the 8 euro/person price tag. We ended up getting much more luck with the various bakeries within walking distance - Opapa's on the main road just outside the hotel, and there was another one on the Dlouha street a little bit farther off.

Show more
Shann , Philippines
Art Deco Imperial Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 122 reviews

Free wifi if you ate in the hotel cafe or having a drink at the bar- just make sure they give it to you complimentary - they charged us a few times but removed it when we reminded them of theses rules.

Also booked hotel transport from airport- although they said the driver would wait if the plane was late we couldn't find the driver after emerging from customs 2 hours late on flight from Dubai so got a taxi. It ended up being 200 k less than hotel quote anyway. Then hotel charged us half quoted price( they said that was very fair on their part) for not being there. We had to speak firmly to cosierge to remind them they had said they would wait and if they'd checked flight schedule thety wouldn't have been inconvenienced and it wasn't our fault.. They refunded this charge as well then. Otherwise hotel staff all pleasant, breakfast was good.

Show more
Wendy , Australia
Esplanade Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 46 reviews

I visit Prague about once a year to relax and other business. This hotel happens to be located in a very convenient location for almost everything you need to see and do in Prague.

You are literally right around the corner from the main strip, also walking distance to various sightseeing spots. There are plenty of restaurants and bars around you as well. The Hotel its self is very nice. Its a rather small hotel but the interior has very gorgeous European vibe, constantly reminding you that you have arrived in Europe. The staff is very friendly and helpful always greeting you with a soft smile. A smile can go a long way especially when you are traveling alone in a different country. The complimentary wifi and breakfast buffet is definitely a plus. This is a hotel I would like to keep coming back to in the future as well.

Show more
Kevin , United States
Salvator Boutique Hotel
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 11 reviews

Le Palais Art Hotel Prague
8.8 Excellent
Based on 18 reviews

Aparthotel City 5
9.4 Exceptional
Based on 245 reviews

My wife and I stay here for 3 nights during our honeymoon trip, Kristina has make our stay wonderful.

Feel like home stay here, with the nice and spacious studio bedroom, clean and comfort room with everything in it. When we arrived, Kristina has greet us warmly with nice welcome drinks. She has prepare a details Prague map and explain to us all the must do and go attractions in details. She has also refer us the money changer which was among the best rate in town with no commission charge. Breakfast was great, Krisitna has make us the best Toast with Ham and Cheese, and very good coffee too. She has recommended one nice Czech food restaurant nearby the hotel, the food and beer is very nice and the price is cheap too. The hotel is located 5 mins walk to Andel metro station with a big shopping complex with Tesco in it. Also, near to many restaurants i.e.: McDonalds, KFC, TGI Fridays, and many local restaurants and pubs. The hotel is around 5-10 mins walking to Dancing house, around 10-15 mins walking to pertain hill where can access to Petrin Prague tower and Prague Castle, around 15-20 mins walking distance to Charles Bridges, old town square and all major attractions, 15-20 mins walking to Vyserad area. Overall is a very good stay and definitely will return again when we visit Prague again the amazing, wonderful and magical city.

Show more
Heng , Malaysia
Hilton Prague Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 126 reviews

arrived at prague main station, and taxi drivers refused to take to the hilton, too close they say.

we arrived at the lokal inn close to midnight for a weekend stay. it was pretty easy to find even during the evening.

the first thing i noticed was that there was a pub downstairs so it was quite noisy even at that hour, which i was worried about. but after we checked in and settled in, it was a bit quieter (i think because the pub was closed by then). the location is excellent, it's literally around the corner from charles bridge (on the prague castle side). we walked to most attractions from our hotel. note: there is no air-conditioning in the roooms!!! as it is a czech national heritage building, they cannot alter the structure. we asked the reception desk if they could do anything and they said they had a few fans but they were all in use in other rooms. anyway we slept with the window open which was fine. but it did mean more noise came in from the street. also note: there is no lift. if you have large suitcases this is highly not recommended. we only had a backpack so were fine. even so we had to walk up 4 flights of stairs at room 22. the room and bathroom were very large, there was an extra area for the table as well. free breakfast was included downstairs in the dining area near the reception and there was quite a large variety. on the last day of our stay we were too lazy to go downstairs for breakfast, so we asked to have our breakfast delivered to our room and they brought up the whole range. it was amazing and hard to believe it was all free! there is a restaurant downstairs which seems to be quite popular but we didn't get to try it, handy if you are too lazy to go out for a meal. the staff were also very helpful in advising us on attractions and directions. they gave us a card to get a free cake at cafe savoy and we had lunch there one day and the food was excellent. the lokal inn is perfect if you would like to stay in a classic place with lots of character but not for those who enjoy modern decor. it's not the cleanest hotel.

Red & Blue Design Hotel Prague
8.6 Excellent
Based on 156 reviews

We arrived in Prague via the train from Vienna and hopped on a trolley to get to the hotel. The hotel was about a 5 minute uphill walk from the trolley stop.

The positive is that when you left the hotel for the day it was downhill. The hotel is across the street from a beautiful park and in October the autumn leaves were just stunning. The park was our view from our room and I couldn't stop snapping pictures. We went with another couple and the husband woke up for early morning runs and found lots of hidden treasures in the park. The hotel room was very clean and free wifi was available in the room. Each room is designed in either red or blue. We got a blue room and it was perfect for our 3 night stay. We also had free breakfast with our stay. The breakfast had a good variety of options to get the day started just right. Assortment of fresh cold cuts with rolls, pastries, sausage, eggs, and many juices, teas, and coffees to choose from. The hotel was very helpful in planning any last minute tours and calling companies on our behalf to find out details. They also helped us book a private car to go to the airport on our last day. The best part of this hotel was that it was about a 15-20 minute walk from the major sights (Charles Bridge and the surrounding area). We didn't have to use the public transportation to get anywhere during our stay. The hotel does not have a restaurant for lunch or dinner and only offers breakfast.

More about Prague

The capital of the Czech Republic, Prague's beauty is undisputed. Famous for historic architecture that spans several eras, Prague is a city of endless photo opportunities, the buildings of the Old Town and Prague Castle particularly stunning. Prague Ruzyne International Airport is around 40 minutes by bus or car from Prague City Center, a trip that can also be made by tram.

Prague's Old Town dates back to the Middle Ages and features narrow cobblestone streets. The heart of the city is its town square, lined with dozens of restaurants, pubs and cafes and where thousands of tourists converge every day. Most of Prague's attractions are within easy walking distance of each other and its outer suburbs are easily accessed via an efficient network of trams and trains.

Accommodation in Prague ranges from the affordable to the lavish – the most centrally located are the hotels in Prague 1, where the Old Town and Prague Castle are situated. Hotels in Prague 2 are also convenient to the sights and can be considerably cheaper. Most city tours and meet-ups take place in the Old Town Square, where the Astronomical Clock and St. Vitus Cathedral are located.

New Town in Prague was constructed in the 14th century and houses boutique shops, restaurants, and cafes, with a large promenade leading up to the famous Wenceslas Square and National Museum. The Vltava River and the Charles Bridge are also must-see attractions in Prague, with many visitors opting to take a river tour.

The location is excellent for getting to and from the airport, as well as for daily sightseeing around Prague's beautiful city. It's worth spending the extra money and getting an Executive room, it's gives you an excellent room, view, free access to the spa (includes great sauna, steam, pool and jacuzzi) and executive lounge. Breakfast was great..... And staff were friendly and helpful. You really couldn't ask for anything more. We loved our weekend in Prague and the hotel had a lot to do with it - would definitely stay again when we are next in Prague. Show more Claire , United Kingdom Friday Hotel 9 Excellent Based on 166 reviews Let me start out by saying the location of this hotel is incredible! Prague is a great walking city and everything is close but this hotel is literally 2-3 minutes walking distance to many of the major tourist sites. Anything else (i.e. Charles Bridge, historical Jewish synagogues, etc.) is 10-15 mins. tops! Also, 24-hour McDonalds is just across the small street (15 second walk), a large grocery store is a few minutes away to buy snacks and drinks for room, Wenceslas Square just a couple of minutes away, full street of shops and restaurants in front of hotel, and the Estates Theatre (where I saw Mozart's The Magic Flute) is only a 1 minute walk away! Now on to the hotel itself. Staff very nice and helpful and always willing to help. The room was modern, clean and well maintained. The daily breakfast was plentiful and diverse but I would recommend to change it up every 1-2 days. For those of us staying for a few days we want to see other options. But the food was always fresh and service was great. The internet was 100% reliable and fast, never had a problem. The TV was small compared to US standards and only had 1 international channel (CNN), but then again, who wants to watch much TV while on holiday? :-) And lastly, the price of the hotel cannot be beat for the location and quality. Not sure if I caught a good deal online or because it was the tail end of the winter when I stayed, but for the price I was very pleased! Show more Jason , United States Radisson Blu Alcron Hotel 9.1 Exceptional Based on 215 reviews I recommend this Hotel to anyone travelling to Prague. Its rooms are of a very high standard in decor & are neat clean & modern. The staff are young, friendly & helpful & went out of their way. The food served at breakfast was a highlight to be looked forward to with a smorgasboard that one would expect in a good hotel & provides comfort when you often cant find what you want in local restaurants. We enjoyed our breakfast & didnt eat again until later in the day. This was a contrast to the rest of our hotel experiences in Europe where beakfast was only a croisant, roll & jam! The locatin is great & in easy walking distance to the old town where all tourist activity is located with walking tours starting from under the clock in the main square. Shopping is closeby. A Subway opposite if you want a cheap snack. I would stay here if I went to Prague again & have already recommended the Raddison to people. Also it was lovely & warm inside while it was snowing outside. I think the windows were double glazed as I didnt hear one sound from outside. Overall it was our best stay in Europe! I highly recommend! Show more Ioana , Romania Lokal Inn 9.1 Exceptional Based on 80 reviews we arrived at the lokal inn close to midnight for a weekend stay. it was pretty easy to find even during the evening. the first thing i noticed was that there was a pub downstairs so it was quite noisy even at that hour, which i was worried about. but after we checked in and settled in, it was a bit quieter (i think because the pub was closed by then). the location is excellent, it's literally around the corner from charles bridge (on the prague castle side). we walked to most attractions from our hotel. note: there is no air-conditioning in the roooms!!! as it is a czech national heritage building, they cannot alter the structure. we asked the reception desk if they could do anything and they said they had a few fans but they were all in use in other rooms. anyway we slept with the window open which was fine. but it did mean more noise came in from the street. also note: there is no lift. if you have large suitcases this is highly not recommended. we only had a backpack so were fine. even so we had to walk up 4 flights of stairs at room 22. the room and bathroom were very large, there was an extra area for the table as well. free breakfast was included downstairs in the dining area near the reception and there was quite a large variety. on the last day of our stay we were too lazy to go downstairs for breakfast, so we asked to have our breakfast delivered to our room and they brought up the whole range. it was amazing and hard to believe it was all free! there is a restaurant downstairs which seems to be quite popular but we didn't get to try it, handy if you are too lazy to go out for a meal. the staff were also very helpful in advising us on attractions and directions. they gave us a card to get a free cake at cafe savoy and we had lunch there one day and the food was excellent. the lokal inn is perfect if you would like to stay in a classic place with lots of character but not for those who enjoy modern decor. it's not the cleanest hotel. The hotel was about a 5 minute uphill walk from the trolley stop. The positive is that when you left the hotel for the day it was downhill. The hotel is across the street from a beautiful park and in October the autumn leaves were just stunning. The park was our view from our room and I couldn't stop snapping pictures. We went with another couple and the husband woke up for early morning runs and found lots of hidden treasures in the park. The hotel room was very clean and free wifi was available in the room. Each room is designed in either red or blue. We got a blue room and it was perfect for our 3 night stay. We also had free breakfast with our stay. The breakfast had a good variety of options to get the day started just right. Assortment of fresh cold cuts with rolls, pastries, sausage, eggs, and many juices, teas, and coffees to choose from. The hotel was very helpful in planning any last minute tours and calling companies on our behalf to find out details. They also helped us book a private car to go to the airport on our last day. The best part of this hotel was that it was about a 15-20 minute walk from the major sights (Charles Bridge and the surrounding area). We didn't have to use the public transportation to get anywhere during our stay. The hotel does not have a restaurant for lunch or dinner and only offers breakfast. Famous for historic architecture that spans several eras, Prague is a city of endless photo opportunities, the buildings of the Old Town and Prague Castle particularly stunning. Prague Ruzyne International Airport is around 40 minutes by bus or car from Prague City Center, a trip that can also be made by tram. Prague's Old Town dates back to the Middle Ages and features narrow cobblestone streets. The heart of the city is its town square, lined with dozens of restaurants, pubs and cafes and where thousands of tourists converge every day. Most of Prague's attractions are within easy walking distance of each other and its outer suburbs are easily accessed via an efficient network of trams and trains. Accommodation in Prague ranges from the affordable to the lavish – the most centrally located are the hotels in Prague 1, where the Old Town and Prague Castle are situated. Hotels in Prague 2 are also convenient to the sights and can be considerably cheaper. Most city tours and meet-ups take place in the Old Town Square, where the Astronomical Clock and St. Vitus Cathedral are located. New Town in Prague was constructed in the 14th century and houses boutique shops, restaurants, and cafes, with a large promenade leading up to the famous Wenceslas Square and National Museum . The Vltava River and the Charles Bridge are also must-see attractions in Prague, with many visitors opting to take a river tour.
